meanings.definition: To quote or refer to (a book or author) incorrectly.
meanings.sent1: She kept misciting the author's name in her research paper.
meanings.sent2: The student was caught misciting the publication date of the book.
meanings.sent3: It was quite amusing when he kept misciting the title of the novel.
meanings.sent4: Her habit of misciting sources was like trying to navigate a maze blindfolded.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of misciting can lead to academic penalties.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake in citing or referencing.
meanings.sent1: He realized he was misciting the source after submitting the report.
meanings.sent2: Avoid misciting information to maintain the credibility of your work.
meanings.sent3: The professor chuckled when the student kept misciting the page numbers.
meanings.sent4: Her tendency to miscite was a slippery slope in her academic journey.
meanings.sent5: The importance of accurate citations cannot be overstated to prevent misciting errors.
